> [{quoted}](name=charcharmunro,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=zbXxVtpx,comment-id=000c,timestamp=2016-04-18T17:40:29.229+0000)
>
> As a Singed main, I object to [anything that threatens my blatantly obvious agenda as a Singed main, uh, for TOTALLY objective selfless reasons.]

*poker face*
#11. Thou shalt spam memes and gifs as much as thou can provide

I'm probably being a grammar nazi but in archaic/shakespearean english, the conjugation goes as follows
[1st person singular] Subjective: I, Objective: Me, Possessive: My or Mine, No present tense conjugation verb ending
[2nd person singular] Subjective: Thou, Objective: Thee, Possessive: Thy or Thine, Present Tense Conjugation Verb Ending: -Est
[3rd person singular] Subjective: He/She/It, Objective: Him/Her/It, Possessive: His/Her/Its, Present Tense Conjugation Verb Ending: -Eth
For all person plurals, it is the same as modern English except 2nd person plural subjective, which is "ye" instead of "you" and they hold no present tense conjugation verb ending.

But this is only for regular verbs, some irregular verbs lose the "e" which denotes "to do" when conjugated in the present tense, creating verbs such as "Thou shalt," "He doth," and "Thou dost."

With this in mind, 1 should be "Thou shalt not chase singed," which is correct.
2 should be "If thou losest lane, thou shalt report the noob jungler," which was half correct.
4 should be "If thine ADC shalt hap to die, thou shalt report thy support" Archaic english should be thought of as extended english. "if your ADC so happens to die, you shall report your (interchangeable with 'the') support," Additionally, the difference in thy and thine is that you use thine if the succeeding word begins with a vowel and thy if the succeeding word begins with a consonant. 
8: "If thou spinest, thou shalt win"
9: "If thou landest a Q with Lee Sin, thou shalt take it"

Also note that when using "the" in archaic english, you follow the same rule as the L-Apostrophe (L') in French. 
Example: The Support, Th' ADC

But those are only 4 examples of what went wrong... there are plenty more. But I will leave this be, either downvote the grammar nazi or carry out, paying no mind, it is your decision.
